Statement: Well, no use sitting around on my scared little ass, I guess. I'll go with you.
Or maybe it'll send me to a pointless death, just like my friends.
Name's Litta Lotta. You lost, or something?
Option 1: Kind of. I could use some help.

Option 2: Heard of the Arc of Life?

Statement: Yeah, it's a city. Well, was. Kind of just a moldy pile of cement now.
You hit your head on the way here or something? There was a flood a long time ago, "end of the world" kind of disaster.
Option 1: That must've been terrible! What else can you tell me?
Option 2: What about the rest of the world?

Statement: I said "end of the world". Should be pretty obvious.
Option 1: What about the Arc of Life? Not all hope's lost if we can just get our hands on it.

Statement: Kid, all my friends died looking for it, and I was the only survivor. That wasteland doesn't care who or what you are, it'll be your grave.
Option 1: I'm sorry, I didn't know that.
Option 2: Tough luck. They probably didn't even know what they were doing.

Statement: Screw you. Is that how you talk about the dead? My friends? Get out of here, I don't want to see you again.
I don't mean to be harsh. I know you want to help us all, but there's not much you can do. You'll die out there like everyone else.

Option 2: Heard of the Arc of Life?

Statement: That thing, of course I have.
Option 2: Awesome, mind if we talk about it.
Option 3: Hmm... something tells me it's not good.

Statement: *Sigh* Adventurous people tend to find death before getting close to that thing.
Look, maybe it's just because I can't get over what happened but I'm not really interested in dying.
Option 2: And yet I'm not giving up.

Statement: I guess we all have to face our fears one way or another.
Option 1: Maybe it's time for you to do so.

Statement: In fact, your situation might present me with that opportunity.
